author: Matt Webb Mitovich
excerpt: In the latest TV show ratings, CBS' 'Tracker' was Sunday's most-watched program and tied for the nightly demo win.
text: Sunday Ratings: Tracker and Watson Grow, Suits LA Opens LowIn the latest TV show ratings, CBS’ Tracker was Sunday’s most-watched program and tied for the nightly demo win. CBS | Leading out of 60 Minutes (6.6 million total viewers and a 0.4 demo rating), Tracker (8 mil/0.4) posted its biggest audience in three episodes and held steady in the demo. Watson (4.6 mil/0.3) also added viewers compared to last week’s regular time slot debut (which was up against NBC‘s boffo SNL 50 special), while the on-the-bubble The Equalizer (3.9 mil/0.2) delivered its second-smallest audience of the season and matched last week’s demo low. NBC | The Americas‘ two-hour premiere averaged 4.7 mil and a 0.4. Suits LA retained just 2.5 mil and a 0.2 (TVLine reader grade “B-“; read post mortem), after which Grosse Pointe Garden Society mustered 1.8 mil and a 0.2 (and a TVLine reader grade of “B+”; read post mortem). FOX | Family Guy did 930K and a 0.2, followed by Grimsburg‘s 670K/0.2, The Great North‘s 550K/0.1 and Krapopolis‘ 490K/0.1. Want SCOOP on any of the TV shows above? The Live+Same Day numbers reported in TVLine’s daily-ish ratings column do NOT reflect a television program’s overall performance, given the increased use of delayed playback via DVR and streaming platforms, plus out-of-home viewing. html:
Sunday Ratings: Tracker and Watson Grow, Suits LA Opens Low

In the latest TV show ratings, CBS’ Tracker was Sunday’s most-watched program and tied for the nightly demo win.

CBS | Leading out of 60 Minutes (6.6 million total viewers and a 0.4 demo rating), Tracker (8 mil/0.4) posted its biggest audience in three episodes and held steady in the demo. Watson (4.6 mil/0.3) also added viewers compared to last week’s regular time slot debut (which was up against NBC‘s boffo SNL 50 special), while the on-the-bubble The Equalizer (3.9 mil/0.2) delivered its second-smallest audience of the season and matched last week’s demo low.

NBC | The Americas‘ two-hour premiere averaged 4.7 mil and a 0.4. Suits LA retained just 2.5 mil and a 0.2 (TVLine reader grade “B-“; read post mortem), after which Grosse Pointe Garden Society mustered 1.8 mil and a 0.2 (and a TVLine reader grade of “B+”; read post mortem).

FOX | Family Guy did 930K and a 0.2, followed by Grimsburg‘s 670K/0.2, The Great North‘s 550K/0.1 and Krapopolis‘ 490K/0.1.

Want SCOOP on any of the TV shows above? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line!

The Live+Same Day numbers reported in TVLine’s daily-ish ratings column do NOT reflect a television program’s overall performance, given the increased use of delayed playback via DVR and streaming platforms, plus out-of-home viewing. These numbers instead aim to simply illustrate trends or superlatives. Steve Harvey is not a judge or lawyer and merely offers an alternative forum of dispute resolution
